metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23981 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
A texture upload of a Pixel Buffer Object could have confused the WebGLcode to skip binding the buffer used to unpack it, resulting in memorycorruption and a potentially exploitable information leak or crash. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 78.9, Firefox < 87, and Thunderbird <78.9.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23981` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 87.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 87.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 87.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required
